general_advisory: Keep the harvested paddy and non-paddy crops in a safe and waterproof place to avoid rainfall and high wind speed. Go for plucking of flowers to avoid deterioration of flower quality. Make strong wooden support for papaya and banana plants to avoid lodging. Harvest mature vegetables and make strong support for trailing type vegetables. Avoid spraying pesticides during this period. Don't let domestic animals outside, provide fodder and clean drinking water. Avoid tying cattle under trees or near any big trees.

advisory: Make a path at an interval of 10 feet for better drainage of rainwater.
Spray 2% salt solution (20 gm salt in 1 litre water) where harvesting of mature rice grain is not possible.
When there is 80-85% ripening in rice grain in the panicle, harvest the crops and store in a safe place.
Safely place harvested grain from the rice field.
Harvested straw should be kept properly.
Take necessary action to protect rice grain in godown from rain.
Aftercare in pulses (Pigeon pea, green gram, black gram), make provision for drainage.
Spray 1.5% chloropyriphos or 0.4% Fenovalarate in to the ridges to check the spreading of black-headed caterpillar pest.
In green gram/black gram, there is a chance of infestation of leaf-eating caterpillar and black-headed caterpillar.
To control, spray mixture of 2 m.l profenophos 50%EC or 2 ml quinalphos 25%EC or 1 ml dichlorovos 76%EC per litre of water.
For aphid pest infestation, spray 2 ml dimethoate 30%EC or 0.3 ml imidachloprid 17.8%SL per litre of water.
For infestation of wilting due to footrot, spray fungicide 2gm Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63%WP per litre of water.
To control powdery mildew, spray mixture of fungicides 1ml Phenoxol 10%EC or 1 ml Propiconazole 25%EC or 1ml Tebuconazole 25.9%EC or 4 gm Sulphur 80%WP.
Make provision for drainage in brinjal.
If seedlings of brinjal or tomato set topple by means of rain, straighten them by staking and earthing up.
Spray Streptocycline and Copper oxychloride to the root zone for wilting in brinjal and tomato.
Make provision for drainage.
Spray Flubendiamide for hairy caterpillar attack.
Spray Difenoconazole or Carbendazim + Mancozeb for cercospora leaf spot.
Spray Fenpyroximate or Propargite to control mites attack.
To control top rot and black spot disease, spray Copper oxychloride.
Make provision for drainage.
Spray Flubendiamide for hairy caterpillar attack.
Spray Difenoconazole or Carbendazim + Mancozeb for cercospora leaf spot.
Spray Fenpyroximate or Propargite to control mites attack.
Spray Copper oxychloride for top rot and black spot disease.
Spray mixture of fungicides for powdery mildew.
Make provision for drainage.
Spray Carbendazim + Mancozeb or Chlorothalonil for sigatoka leaf spot.
Make provision for drainage.
Spray Imidachloprid or Thiomethoxam to prevent mealy bug and aphid.
To control red palm weevil, apply Carbendazim + Sand in the hole of the stem.
To control Rhinocerous beetle, clean and disinfect nearby compost yard.
Provide adequate drainage facilities in nursery beds.
Cover the nursery bed with white polythene film during rain.
Sow seeds after seed treatment and appropriate soil moisture.
Apply Metalaxyl + Mancozeb or Captan + Hexaconazole after rain for collar rot in seedlings.
